title: 113_s2246
content: The "District of Columbia Budget Accountability Act of 2014" establishes the fiscal year for the District of Columbia and allows for changes by an Act of the Council. It also amends the enactment of the local budget by the District of Columbia. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 70 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the budget must be submitted to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific budget procedures. Prohibitions are in place for unauthorized obligations and expenditures. Prohibitions are in place for unauthorized obligations and expenditures by the District of Columbia government, requiring approval by the Council or Congress before any amount can be obligated or expended. Restrictions also apply to reprogramming of amounts. After the annual budget is adopted, reprogramming of amounts requires Mayor's request and Council approval, with offsetting expenditures. Definitions and conforming amendments are also specified. The text chunk discusses amendments to various sections of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 related to section 446. The amendments involve inserting new references and striking existing ones to clarify the application of section 446 in different contexts. Amendments to section 446 of the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act involve inserting new references and striking existing ones to clarify its application in different contexts. Amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act involve changes to the process of enacting the local budget and addressing line-item vetoes by the Mayor. Additionally, the Act now allows for the hiring of employees if the position is authorized by the Council. Amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act include changes related to the budget process and the role of the Mayor. Additionally, the Act allows for the hiring of employees authorized by the Council. Section 447 is amended to specify the authority of the Council and Congress in different years. Other conforming amendments to the Home Rule Act are made regarding changes in the federal role in the budget process. Section 603 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to ensure a balanced budget transmission by the Council under specific provisions. Section 602(c) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to specify the effective date of Acts transmitted under certain conditions. If the Act is not for a control year, it will take effect after a 30-day period, with extensions if necessary. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to specify that if a joint resolution disapproving an Act passes both Houses of Congress and is transmitted to the President within a certain period, the resolution will repeal the Act upon becoming law. SEC. 8. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS RELATING TO FEDERALLY AUTHORIZED ADJUSTMENTS TO LOCAL APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 8. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS RELATING TO FEDERALLY AUTHORIZED ADJUSTMENTS TO LOCAL APPROPRIATIONS. (a) Acceptance of Grants Not Included in Adopted Budget. Amends Section 446B(a) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act to allow acceptance of amounts without approval by Act of Congress. Reports to congress are also amended to include additional committees. (b) Authority To Increase Spending in Case of General Fund. The Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2009 is amended to allow the Mayor to notify specific committees in case of increased revenue collections for spending adjustments. The Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2009 is amended to change the wording regarding the amount of local funds in the District of Columbia budget. The Financial Services and General Government Appropriations Act, 2009 is amended to change wording in the District of Columbia budget submission to Congress. This includes updating reporting requirements to notify specific committees in the House of Representatives and Senate. The amendments made by this Act will be effective starting from fiscal year 2015 and each subsequent fiscal year.
